First off, I don't know how you can beat this location while visiting San Francisco unless you are big into shopping and the theater, in which case a room in the Union Square area would be better. The Vitale is right on Embarcadero, and about 1/4 of a block from the Ferry Building which is sort of our local temple of foodie worship. On Saturdays there is a large Farmer's Market as well. A room on the "water" side of the hotel makes for some pretty great people watching up and down Embarcadero. No television required.First the good - the room is large, spacious, with very tall ceilings and beautiful picture windows. One would not feel cramped here even after a four or five day stay. The bed is soft and very comfortable - linens luscious. The bathtub in the room, while a very simple tub without the fancy jets etc., is to DIE FOR. I walk by the Vitale all the time and wondered about the privacy issue and when you're up in the room looking out you realize .... no one's looking up from the street! No one cares - they are busy admiring the view of the bay. Once I got in the tub, I followed suit.As noted here in other reviews, shower in the bath is an overhead rainfall type with simple and clean partial glass enclosure. Very classy. Room service - blindingly fast. Breakfast arrived in under 15 minutes. Now the negatives. The noise from the street is pretty intense. Unless you're from NYC or live in the city, this might get to you after a while. This is NOT a quiet and peaceful location. Expect bus and intersection noise to be a factor as early as 6:00 a.m. There was no in room coffee, and I had to call room service for two wine glasses. The toilet was one of the water saver models and simply didn't work. I would stay at the Vitale again but next time would opt for a city view room or there's a side of the hotel that overlooks a small park. The Panoramic Suite is very pretty and almost warrants a room rate most of us think twice about.

May 16 2009 	Excellent hotel location service views - just fantastic!	We stayed here for 2 weeks and the service did not falter once. We upgraded our original internal view booking (made via Expedia) for a water view and enjoyed fantastic views of the Bay Bridge, Ferry Building and Treasure Island. The room was very clean and spacious, the bathroom had a large "rain" shower and the bed linens, especially the pillows were devine.The staff were were nice and cheerful, the restaurant was also pretty good - it took advantage of the two Farmer's Market days over the road at the ferry building (Tuesdays and Saturday's) extending a special dish on those evenings. The bar seemed to be the place to go throughout the week so it could get noisy (Saturday and Sunday were much quieter) but the double glazed windows in the room blocked out most of the noise so we didn't find it a problem.If you don't have a room with a view you can easily get up to the hotel rooftop, to admire the sunrise and sunsets or even take a picnic. The hotel has a free yoga class in the morning and a small gym but guests also enjoy free access to the YMCA just a 2 minute walk away. Rooms had free internet provision (wireless and cable), a safe, minibar and very nice toiletries. Possibly the only thing to be aware of is that there were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room (I had a travel kettle with me so it wasn't a problem).I think it would be hard to beat this hotel. I'm giving it 10 out of 10 !

May 11 2009 	Awesome Hotel	This place is expensive, but awesome. Our room had a view of the bay, & the ferry building. The modern decor looked like something out of a magazine. If I had enough money I would stay here every time I am in the city.

May 6 2009 	Charged me twice for one night - refused to credit	While this was a nice hotel to stay in it hit a new low in customer service: I discovered the same night charged on two different credit cards, the corporate one used for holding the room and the personal one I used to pay. When I asked for a credit Megan in reservations informed me that they had held a second room for me so they would not credit. Care to put that in writing, Megan? They made an error in their booking system and the customer has to pay? Good thing this was business travel and I have the muscle of a company account behind me. If you are considering this hotel for personal travel buyer beware.

Apr 28 2009 	Great hotel but service can be sketchy if they get too busy.	The boyfriend and I stayed here for one night on Vday weekend. When booking through their website, I got the Deluxe Waterfront King with the romance package which includes champagne on arrival and rose petal turndown service. The lobby is decorated beautifully and had a peaceful, serene feel to it. The people working at the concierge were also great and was able to get me a room on the 8th floor (highest floor).The room had an awesome view of the Bay Bridge and the water. Also cant complain about the rainforest shower and Fresh products, loooved the Lemon scented lotion and took all of them home. :) Location was great as well since it is right across the Ferry Building. The bf and I also got a couples massage which was only ok for me. Ok, here are my complaints. Since it was a busy Vday weekend, the service was only ok. The champagne was not in my room when we arrived like it was supposed to as described on their website. I had to call housekeeping about it which pretty much ruined the surprise I planned for my BF. When checking out thru their in-room checkout service, there were so many people trying to do the same thing at the same time that the service was overloaded. When I went downstairs to checkout, there was a long line which made a 10 minute task into a 30 minute process.Overall, I really liked the hotel and had a great weekend getaway. Would definitely come back, maybe on a less busy weekend.

Apr 24 2009 	Fab location	We stayed in one of the 180 degree Panoramic suites on the last night of our Honeymoon and it was the perfect finish.The view was amazing taking in most of the bay from the Bay Bridge past The Ferry Building and almost to Alcatraz. The only problem was that the Embarcadero was quite noisy. We live in London so were used to it but it might disturb some people.Service was great and the Valet and Bellboys did not appear to expect to be tipped for every little thing they did which was a welcome change.The bar looked very cool but we arrived at about 1800 on a Friday night so it was packed with local office workers.My wife really enjoyed the free hour of yoga in the morning.I would definitely recommend splashing out on the Panoramic suite. Bobby Tang (reservationist) was particularly helpful in booking the room.As other reviewers have said join the JDV club for points, discounts and upgrades.

Apr 1 2009 	We love this hotel but....................	You have no idea where they are putting you-We have stayed at the Vitale before. This stay I called reservations directly. I knew exactly the room type I wanted and was willing to pay the extra $$$. The rooms in the hotel make a big difference to the quality of your stay. I was told we would be on 6-8th floor with water view. Got to hotel and told there is no such quarentee and was given a room on 3 with view a patch of water and wall. Went back said i would rather have a room like we prior stayed in- city view and was given the choice of the same room we had before- I was told they would adjust price- well when we got to check out after a 4 day stay my city view room and deluxe water view reservation came to a difference of 9 dollars a night- I overheard many problems at the front desk while sitting in the lobby.One couple I talked to said the front desk told them they shouldn't book thru the hotel but expedia or some other service. I was totally confused checking in and checking out. Maybe that is how they break you down to spend top dollar for whatever room you finally wind up with. Its too bad since the hotel is lovely- great location. Beware coming off the elevator at restaurant's happy hour time- the noise coming from the bar sounds like a wind tunnel!!

Mar 24 2009 	My new favorite hotel in San Francisco!	This is a great small hotel, with an unbeatable location right on the Embarcadero. Our room had a view of the Bay Bridge, Ferry Island, and Treasure Island, and on the 7th floor was very quiet. (The bar is a noisy scene, so I'd recommend getting a room away from that and as far up as you can)The concierge and front desk staff are very helpful, the appointments in the rooms are outstanding, and the large bathrooms with walk in shower and overhead "rain" showerhead are great. This is the first hotel I remember that had a small sauna bench in the shower, and another one by the mirror to use the dressing table.The restaurant is good although pricey for what you get. I found that room service food had too big a quantity - we could easily share a breakfast entree.You should be able to negotiate a bit on price, although it is expensive. But worth it!

Mar 12 2009 	My new Favorite....	It was perfect from start to finish. We checked in and we were offered a warm towel to wash the travel off - I loved it! The staff was sincere and very professional. Couldn't have been nicer. Front desk, conceirge, restaurant personel, bell captains, housekeeping etc. We and two other couples were impressed. In fact one couple we were with came back the following weekend. Perfect location and a great expirence. Hotel Vitale is our new favorite. We will be back! Thank you Vitale...

Mar 8 2009 	Nice but overrated	Owned and operated by some San Francisco hotel guy how owns many different hotels in the city.Hotel is nice, well located and service is good. Especially the consierge, Brian, was fantastic and helped us a lot. One of the best!!!The bar gets pretty crowded at night and is a nice place to get a drink before going out.Rooms are modern and clean. They come with many small goodies like the soho grand - oxygen, jelly candy, intimacy set etc.. fun! However, at USD 275 it also comes at a price.BEWARE - you can get cheaper deals booking this hotel on orbiz than other places. Their own webpage claims to be cheapest but it comes with a drop down menu where you can choose between 'BEST RATE', 'best rate' etc etc. Only one of the options is cheap - very confusing. This ended up costing us around USD 130 more then it should which the hotel would not refund us despite their money back guarantee.Will not be back.

Mar 6 2009 	I wanted to like this hotel	I used to live in SF and know that the bar at Hotel Vitale rocks! That said, the rooms do not rock. The cityview rooms are small and I saw a bunch of them.... since the first room I got was a floor above the valet parking and you could hear the bar and the parking lot. I was showed three other rooms and they were all small. Finally, the room service was not impressive. A $30 chicken breast was tiny and I got 5 vegetables when I ordered a side of veggies. Good location, bar, etc.

Feb 10 2009	Basically very goo.	Hotel Vitale, San Franciso 12/31/08-1/5/09It was a real treat to spend 5 nights at Hotel Vitale. The location was delightful: on The Embarcadero, opposite The Ferry Building, a couple of blocks from the California St. cable car and a 15 minute walk to Union Square, There were also many fine restaurants we could walk to in addition to Americano, the excellent restaurant in the hotel.The room we had was a notch or two larger than I expected. The dcor was very boutique-hotel, with restful pale blue added to the usual beiges and browns. A long wooden unit contained generous desk space, the mini bar, some storage and an extensive selection of snacks, candies etc. for sale. (I always immediately put these in a drawer or the closet shelf. I dont like the clutter or the temptation.) A chaise longue near the window was a great place to watch the constant traffic of ships gliding under the Bay Bridge just outside. The bathroom was rather lame for such a deluxe hotelPainted sheetrock wall, a nondescript (well, it was squarish) counter sink, not great lighting. Actually it wasnt deluxe at all. I had major internet issues that could not be fixed even after long conversations with the tech crew in Georgia. If good internet connection is important to you, sign up for the costly premium connection when you first arrive. It was impossible for me to switch once I had signed up for five days. Definitely a flaw. If it had been a working trip, I probably would have had to go to another hotel. Joie de Vivre should offer acceptable free internet serviceOr not bother with free service.That said, the staff did their best. We had a note and wine and lots of sympathy from the front desk crew. Its a wonderful hotel that I can enthusiastically recommend with that one craveat.
Feb 3 2009 	So Perfect!	We checked in for the weekend and loved every minute. Fantastic location, great staff.

Feb 1 2009 	We like Vitale a lot	We were very impressed with Hotel Vitale. I'll give you a quick summary.First, we booked the week of our stay, requesting a Deluxe City View, which is one step up from a standard room. Since we contacted the hotel directly by phone, we expressed our concerns about noise and they honored that request with a higher-up room facing south (which meant that we had a partial Bay View and could see some of the bridge). The rate was heavily discounted because of the season. After booking, we found a better rate on travelzoo.com and the hotel honored it.The front desk staff, both at check in, and the concierge, are totally on top of their game. At check in the manager on duty who handled our check-in noted our request for a quiet room and gave us the best thing he had, and we were pleased. During our stay, the concierge gave us great advice on nearly restaurants. The housekeeping service pays attention to small details. For example, we brought some bottled water, and they took the extra effort to put it on ice for us.The hotel is clean, modern and updated. It offers free wi-fi in the rooms (at a slower bit rate; faster datastreams cost $10). I'd say it's nicer than a W, but hip in a similar vein.There are multiple roof-top patios with great views -- don't miss them.Things to note: Request a higher floor to avoid noise. Bay View rooms are noisier due to the Embarcadero. City View Rooms don't have much view. Best option is to request north or south facing rooms. The bar is loud and very "happening". Don't expect a lot of big hotel amenities --- the gym is small, there is no pool, and there is no cafe (although there is a restaurant, and plenty of food at the Ferry Building across the street.)Parking is really tough in the area. The hotel charges $45 + tax, but you can find nearby garages for less (we kept our car at the Rincon Center a block away). Remember, parking meters start at 7am-6pm, M-Sat. Sunday is free.The Ferry Building across the street has lots to see and eat, but can be overwhelming on Saturdays. Still, it's worth spending time there. If you want to go to the Slanted Door (a hot, pan-Asian restaurant), book ahead.All in all, I'd highly recommend Hotel Vitale. -Robert

Jan 29 2009 	Loved the Hotel Vitale	The location is excellent for business in the Financial District but also for general sightseeing as it is very close to the Embarcadero BART station. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and well decorated. I'm a stickler for nice bedding and towels and I was not disappointed.Also of note is the hotel bar and restaurant. I almost never dine in hotel restaurants but I did try the one in this hotel and thought it was very good. The bar is quite the happening spot and may even be a bit too loud and crowded for some people.I will be in San Francisco for business often over the next five months and plan to stay at the Hotel Vitale every time.

Jan 24 2009 	Fantastic experience at Hotel Vitale	I went to a conference in San Francisco and tried to stay at the hotel where the conference was being held. On the day before the conference, the other hotel raised their rates almost $80, so I looked around for a better deal and a nicer hotel. i found both at the Hotel Vitale. While usually more expensive than I care to spend, Hotel Vitale offers discounts for last minute reservations and for local Bay Area residents. The staff were amazing friendly and helpful and the facilities were spectacular in their cleanliness and tasteful amenities. The outdoor terraces are beautiful, especially at night and even in the rain. My room was quiet, although I was awoken at about 5 in the morning by a garbage truck picking up recycling on the street below. I've stayed i many hotels in SF for business, so this is not an unusual occurrence in my experience. If I can afford it or find a special deal, I'll definitely stay at the Hotel Vitale again!

Dec 1 2008	Spectacular Views	What a great experience! We came over from the East Bay for a wedding and get away weekend. We lucked into unusually warm fall weather and we were upgraded to one of the corner rooms with wrap around window view of San Francisco Bay and the Bay Bridge. Does it get any better? The room and staff were great and the views were spectacular. Great location for walking along the Embarcadero and lunch outside along the Bay.

Nov 22 2008 	Great Location	This was the last stop of our honeymoon and we wished we could have stayed longer.The hotel is set on one of the main streets near to the Bay Bridge and also next to the bay.The staff were very friendly and professional upon our arrival and soon had us settled in our room. This was located on the second flor over the entrance with the view of the main street and the bay bridge. We personally loved this and didn't experience any noise or problems. The room was small but comfortable, with every available amenity and luxurious bedding.There was an internet room available right near our room which was great to keep in contact with friends and family. We did not eat in the hotel, so can't comment on the food. However, there is a fab place opposite called the Boulevard, very expensive but the food is of excellent quality.Our only criticism of the hotel was that out of all the hotels we stopped in on our honeymoon, this was the most expensive and didn't make us feel special. As mentioned in other reviews, we received some kind of gift at other places i.e. wine but not in this hotel.Other than the above, the hotel is a great place to stop, right near the main front and not far from pier 39!

Nov 18 2008 	What A Gem!!	Our 7 night stay at the Vitale was wonderful from start to finish. We had a deluxe bay front room on the 7th floor which was lovely. The view from the wall-to-wall window of the bay bridge was awesome. All off the staff were wonderful and accommodating, including the front desk, the concierge, bellmen and especially housekeeping. Our rooms were always cleaned as soon as we left in the morning. We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant twice which we enjoyed. Boulettes Larder in the Ferry Building across the street served a great breakfast. (don't miss it) The hotel's lounge and outdoor bar/patio was open late and got very crowded. Despite this we never had any problem with noise. The hotel was in a great location away from all the hustle and bustle of Fisherman's Wharf. If we were to return to SF, we would definitely stay here again.

Nov 12 2008 	best location for people in the know	just got back from a 3 week trip in america and stayed at the vitale for 4 nights. From the outside it seems quite unassuming but once inside its a lovely hotel and the rooms are full of high end fixtures and fittings.The staff were all very helpful and friendly.As the other reviews have said the bar does get busy with the city boys after 5 but its quieter on sat and sun evenings.we were in the top floor and had a great view of the bay bridge.worth the extra money.We walked all over the centre,from fishermans wharf to lombard st,the italian quarter and union square.Fishermans wharf really is a tourist trap and tacky and union square is just dept stores,but the rest of the city is great.tip..go to shanghai 1930 restaurant,its 50 yards away,the food is great and the live jazz bands set the mood perfectly in the cocktail lounge.There are lots of other great bars and restaurants within 300m but 1930 was our favourite.We would stay at the vitale again without hesitation.A+

Nov 6 2008 	Very nice and clean great location BUT VERY NOISY ROOMS!!!	I don't normally stay at hotels this nice, but my business paid for it. The rooms are nice and feature a lot of extras, like free shoe polishing, water bottle, a little card with the next day's temperature, etc. The room was clean and I wasn't afraid to walk around with bare feet or touch the bedspread. However, the one major fault I have with this hotel was its noise. I have stayed on both the 5th and 7th floors, bay view rooms, and have been able to hear the following: the elevator doors opening and closing, the maid's closet door opening and closing numerous times, music and talking from other rooms, and cars honking outside.The view from the room is magnificent and its location can't be beat. I've run along the Embarcadero each morning and all you have to do is cross the street. The staff is excellent and will find a taxi for you anytime, but I just couldn't get over how loud my room was for the price my firm paid.

Nov 4 2008 	Sparkling fresh and new.	I stayed in the Vitale for three nights when I was in town for a convention at the Moscone Center which is a brisk 20 minute walk up Mission Street. The hotel was only built 3 1/2 years ago and it is still looking fresh and new. I liked the location next to the Oakland Bay Bridge and the Embarcadero. In my view its preferable to a hotel right in the city center. In any case, you can catch a cab to just about anywhere in 5 - 10 minutes.I loved the modern decor of the lobby, bar and bedrooms which are all spacious and bright. The hotel is low rise so you don't have to wait any time for the elevators. The staff were extremely helpful and courteous.A couple of minor gripes. The service at breakfast was sluggish and I could have done with a coffee maker in my bedroom although room service did offer to bring one up to me.All in all I'd be very happy to return to the Vitale and recommend it to others.

Oct 29 2008 	Who gets the good rooms?	Traveling to San Francisco a few times a year for business, we are still trying to find the right hotel. This was our second try for Hotel Vitale, and we are not sure whether we'll give it another. We were arriving in SF from overseas, and requested a quiet room. Our flight was 8 hours late, so we arrived exhausted. At the front desk we asked if the room was quiet, and was assured that it was. Well, when we opened the door to the room, we were assalted by the bass from the bar downstairs...not even close to quiet. We called downstairs and they showed us a room in the back corner, where it was quiet, but dirty, broken closet doors. The third room we were shown was right on Mission street, and the valet assured us that it would be quite noisy in the morning. Choosing sleep, we opted for the quiet room.The next morning we asked for a better room and for $60 extra (making the room charge over $400) we were moved to a room on a higher floor, remarkably cleaner and with a great view of the Bay.Our take on this hotel is that if you pay the big dollars, the rooms are quiet and clean. If you choose a more inexpensive room, expect it to be noisy and not as clean as you would like it to be. San Francisco is very expensive, but there has to be a hotel where if you pay $300/night, you can expect a clean room and a good nights sleep. Unfortunately, Hotel Vitale is not it.The positives for this hotel are its location and friendly staff.

Oct 25 2008 	A little gem perfectly located with awesome views	In celebrating my husband's birthday, we wanted a quiet get-away weekend while checking out the Fleet Week in San Francisco. Great little modern boutique hotel situated perfectly right across the Embarcadero building and awesome eateries everywhere including the hotel's own Americano. After taking the night time Alcatrez tour getting back to the hotel past 10pm - we were famished and ordered the short ribs and "mac n cheese" which were "to die for" comfort food.When we got back to the hotel, they surprised us with two cupcakes and a happy birthday wish - which really made me look good - since I was rushed to plan the weekend and didn't think about some of the details.We ended the weekend with messages in their spa - which capable masseuse made up for the somewhat surprising small facility. Combined with beautiful weather, and gorgeous views - I'd recommend staying at this little gem on your next stay in SF.

Oct 10 2008 	Wonderful hotel great location	I stayed in the Vitale in June on a solo trip to San Francisco in June. It really was the perfect choice:- The rooms are lovely  very relaxing with comfortable bed. I moved half way through my stay to an urban studio  wonderful relaxing bathroom. - The beds are very comfortable  and the room was always spotless.- The location is fantastic  I wandered down to the Ferry Building for breakfast every day. The best thing there was Boulettes larder  dont miss it. Also the hotel gives complementary access to the nearby YMCA  great to take a spinning class for an early morning pick me up  and you can workout with a view of the bay bridge.- Its easy to walk to everywhere you need to go  but also right by the Embarcadero BART for the airport (and subway for elsewhere) plus the mini and cable car. - The views of the bay are great  and I had a meal in the restaurant too which was good.As well as being beautiful, the location isnt touristy like Fishermans Wharf, nor edgy like some others areas. The staff are fantastic too  great recommendations and always with a smile.

Oct 8 2008 	A Perfect Stay	We have stayed at other JDV hotels which is one reason I picked Hotel Vitale. We completed the last days of our Honeymoon in San Francisco and decided to try Vitale due to their location and their excellent reviews on trip advisor. We were not disappointed in any way. Megan was great in making our reservations and noting it was our Honeymoon. First off, our room was upgraded to waterfront view. Since it was not ready on arrival, Daniel offered us drinks in Americano's bar. We had two drinks each which the hotel picked up. We were then shown to our room which had an amazing view of the East Bay bridge. Off we went for dinner and upon our return, Champagne and chocolates were left at our bedside. Romantic is the only word I can think of due to the soft music and low lights left on for us. It was a little noisy due to the bar downstairs, but we just kept the soft music on until the bar closed. The noise was not something you could really hear unless you focused on it. We slept VERY soundly during our stay there, yes the beds are perfect too.There was a running race I decided to run Sunday morning and again, they help to direct me to the place to sign up and gave me some bandaids prior to my run. Little things that convey their committment to customer service. We didn't try Americano only because we have our favorite places to eat in SF. We loved our stay at this hotel that modestly claims to be a three star hotel. It was a perfect stay and we plan on staying here many more times.

Oct 6 2008 	my favorite hotel in San Francisco	I frequently travel to San Francisco and this is my favorite place to stay. They do everything right here, from the service at the front door to the amendities. I appreciate getting the New York Times, Fresh products and a gym pass to the YMCA down the block. Also, I love the short walk to the Ferry Building.

Oct 5 2008 	What a view from the room !	This is third visit to San Francisco and this time, we actively took the decision to stay in a completely different areas and get off the beaten track a little bit and not stay near Union Square (2 years ago we stayed at The Clift). The views from the room was the reason we booked this hotel. Well we did splash out and get bay bridge room and it was worth it - it was a suite and the view from the room was fantastic. Would definitely recommend this hotel and if you can stretch to the bat bridge room, you wont regret it and it is well worth every penny !!!

Sep 18 2008 	Loved the Vitale	Nice, clean, NEW!!. We were in a basic room with 2 beds, a chair and a nice view of the Ferry Building. The room was not large, but was adequate and well designed.Bath was very nice. Good showerhead. Wonderful bath amenities. Loved the soaps and shampoo. The brand was "Fresh".The bed was TDF (to die for). This had to be one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in. Very nice sheets, lots of pillows. The bellmen were extremely helpful in jockeying/jamming all our stuff and our bodies in the vehicle. At that point, I think they were glad to see us go!Finally, the location of the Vitale is EXCELLENT!Hotel Vitale: THUMBS UP!!

Sep 16 2008 	Fell in love with SF 	Our stay at the Vitale was wonderful from start to finish. We arrived on a Friday evening and it was exciting to see such a vibrant and happening scene at the hotel. The noise was not an issue for us during any part of the stay. The hotel staff was very gracious and accomodating. We were impressed by the complimentary bottle of sparkly in honor of our anniversary, along with cards from the hotel and housekeeping. It was a wonderful gesture by the hotel and made our first trip to SF all the more memorable.The location is, in my opinion, the best in the city. The Sat. morning Farmers Market is not to be missed and it was very easy to access public trans. to other parts of the city. What I liked the most was coming back to the serene decor and ambiance of the hotel after a busy day of shopping and exploring the city. The rooftop patios are a haven - one of the best spots to take it all in.For the leisure traveler, Hotel Vitale is a wonderful place. If you're a true spa-goer or business traveler though, it may not suit you.

Sep 13 2008 	Great Location but Terrible Internet Policy	My husband and I spent a pleasant weekend at the Hotel Vitale in May.What we liked:1. Fabulous location on Embarcadero across from the Ferry Building2. Amazing (and underused) roof deck with views onto the Bay3. Comfortable rooms. We had one of the oddly shaped Urban Studio rooms (they're concave, believe it or not), which was good value for the size. The spacious bath area was particularly appreciated.4. Wonderful toiletries from Fresh cosmeticsWhat we didn't like:1. Their Internet policy. Yes, wireless Internet was free, but that was only the lower speed wireless Internet. If it weren't for this, I would have awarded the Vitale five stars.2. The decor. The beige and ice blue color scheme was soothing, but had something of the feel of a chain hotel. And did the room art come from a yard sale? Or was it high end art pretending to come from a yard sale? Too complicated for me. . .

Sep 10 2008 	Incredible view; wonderful concierge	Arriving at Hotel Vitale after 27 hours in transit was a seamless entry into a serene world of pampering luxury. The circular suite on the sixth floor provided sweeping views of the Bay Bridge, while the room itself was tastefully appointed with comfortable furnishings and luxe Fresh bath products.Vitale's location is excellent for the pedestrian guest. The adjacent Ferry Building boasts a Saturday morning farmers' market that is second to none, and the heart of downtown is within easy walking distance.Perhaps best of all was the incredibly personable concierge, Jackie, who assisted with reservations at outstanding restaurants across the city and ensured that all five nights spent at her property were memorable.

Aug 29 2008 	Beware of noise!!!	Not as wonderful as we had hoped. Waterfront view was gorgeous but only through a small window; the staff was gracious and helpful. Definitely not the restful getaway we were anticipating.

Aug 26 2008 	loved the vitale	we loved this hotel - though the bar is very popular and loud in the evening although they're the 'after work crew' and disapear by 9.30pm. Very helpful staff and great location.

Aug 25 2008 	In the middle of so many restaurants	The hotel staff were very personable. We dropped off our luggage while the room was being prepared. We had arrived two or three hours before check in. When we came back at 3:00PM, there were no delays. The room overlooked the Bay Bridge and is directly across the street from the Ferry building at Embarcadero. The walk towards South of Market area is very reasonable. The bedding was nice. The sitting area and room sizes were also spacious for this location. We ate dinner here on Friday night because the restaurant across the street had an emergency and was shut down. I would recommend the restaurant for non-guests and the outside patio / bar area was packed from rush hour til 9 or 10 every night.The rooftop areas on the live roof and the spa areas were also very nice and clean. I would highly recommend staying here. Especially if you do not mind the extra five or six block walk to areas outside of the Embarcadero area.

Aug 2 2008 	Excellent Hotel Staff not Amazing	We stayed at Hotel Vitale for two nights, weekend in July '08. We were in town for a family event. The hotel is beautiful, with modern chic decor, very enjoyable. The check-in process was quick, though unfriendly. When I called to complain they wanted $20/night extra to move me to a quieter room which faces the inner yard. The new room was exactly the same (actually a bit smaller), only two floors up. Jul 28 2008 	Home away from Home	We drove from Santa Barbara to the Hotel, very easy to get location.Turned the car over to Valet and enjoyed the city. Jul 24 2008 	Good service convenient location	I stayed at the Hotel Vitale for the second time for a business trip. The front desk was very helpful. Jul 21 2008 	Great Service	This hotel is amazing. We felt like royalty. The staff attends to your every need - whatever paper you want, whatever temperature you like... Jul 16 2008 	Hotel that can't shoot straight	The Vitale was a total, total disappointment. The location is very good and the facilities are fine. But service was just bad, very bad. They try hard, and are personally nice, but really cant get it right. For the price they charge, the level of service delivered is unacceptable. I have stayed here for 11 nights (tonight is the last night, I am actually posting this from the hotel), so I believe my view is based on a good sample of what happens there, and not on some fluke (positive or negative). Here is a list of what went wrong. You judge for yourself.Day 1: I arrive with my son on July 4th for a 12 day stay. Upon check in I ask whether there is any place in the property where we could see the fireworks and are told no. Next day we go to the 8th floor and see that indeed there was a terrace from where one could see the fireworks. But maybe it was taken for some event. So, we understand. I also notice that despite the fact that we are staying for 12 days, our room has no view (note a bad view, but no view  windows into a tiny courtyard/service area). Fine, I think, it corresponds to wat I was paying. None of these two events constitute bad service, but they did not build any goodwill with me. Not a problem if things run smoothly. We will see.Day 2: We go for breakfast at Americano, the Hotels restaurant and arrive at about 8 am, there are two tables already eating and we are the third. We are told to seat wherever we wanted. Service is horrible. It took 10 minutes to get a menu. My sons order arrives after 10, and mine (two eggs and toast) never come. After he finishes eating, I ask for the check (and then my eggs arrive). I leave without breakfast and decide not to use the restaurant again.In the afternoon we decide to take a cab from the hotel to go to a Jazz Festival. We walk out and I ask the bellman for a cab. He is moving cars, which are parked in front of the hotel. I look at my watch and realize that after standing there for 6 minutes, nobody has even called a cab. So, we walk out, and find a cab for ourselves.Day 3: I call at 6:15am or so and order breakfast in the room, to avoid the restaurant service and to see the Wimbledon final on TV. They say it would be in my room by 6:50. At 6:35 I get a call from Penny saying they are having problems in the kitchen and it will take longer for the breakfast to be ready and that it will be in my room at 7:15. Fine, I say. It does not arrive by 7:15. So, I call the guest service line at 7:20 and Tania  without checking  tells me it is on its way. I ask her to check and she says she will call me back. Penny calls me back and says the order will be in my room by 7:30. It arrives at 7:35am. The nice woman who brought it either was not trained to deliver room service (did not offer to open the water bottle, put tray on desk in the wrong way, did not leave cart/table in the room to serve as a table for the two of us to be able to eat, etc) or was in a hurry to do something else. We did not get what we ordered (some toast was missing), but we ate it anyway, as we were starving.Day 4: We order breakfast in the room for two people. They come and deliver a tray without a cart. So, one of us has to have breakfast standing. The person who brought the breakfast told me he could not leave the cart in the room, did not offer to open the bottle of water for me (at this point I dont expect this level of service anymore), and did not notice that there was only one glass. I called to complain about it, but the second glass arrived 20 min later (we already had eaten breakfast)Day 6: I have to stay a bit later working in the room. At 11 I leave the room, stop by reception and ask them to get my room cleaned. I come back by 2:15 and the room is still not clean. Day 7-Day 11: We basically did not use any hotel services and got used to lousy, sub-standard in room service for breakfast. It is pretty clear that the people delivering the service are just not trained to deliver service corresponding to the hotel rates.Day 11 at night: I knew I might have to take a later flight after checking out, so I went to the front desk during my stay and asked if I could check out at 4 pm (I would be willing to extend my stay for a day if that were not possible). I am told there will be no problem, just to confirm with the front desk the night before departing. So, I just went downstairs and asked if I could have a late check out. They said they are fully committed and I cant. I then ask if I can stay one more day, and they say that I cant (but they would store my luggage for me  arent they nice?). Anyway, for the price they change this is certainly a sub-standard hotel. I will not come back and do not recommend it. If you will stay in the hotel for one or two nights as part of a leisure trip it is probably OK, but if you will stay for longer or will be in town for business and need good levels of service, probable best to stay away.

Jul 9 2008 	contemporary and stylish	This was our second stay at the Hotel Vitale and will certainly not be the last. The hotel enjoys an excellent location across from the ferry building. Public transportation is easily accessible whether by streetcar (which travels along market as well as to fisherman's wharf), buses, cable cars, BART and the muni. We use BART from the airport and are dropped off 2 blocks from the hotel. The rooms are contemporary and comfortably furnished. We have stayed in both a waterfront room as well as the urban studio room. The spa is compact but features excellent therapists. We used the hotel restaurant only for breakfast which was efficient and delicious. We typically dine at Boulevard (located across the street) and Slanted Door which is located in the Ferry building. San Francisco is a city of neighborhoods and in picking a hotel, you must decide on a surrounding ambience whether it is by the water (which we like), high up on one the hills, in the middle of shopping like union square or in a more residential area like the marina district. Overall our stays at the Vitale have been relaxing and enjoyable and we certainly plan to return.

Jul 1 2008	Hotel Vitale -- very relaxing	My wife and I periodically stay in SF and have really enjoyed the Vitale. The location is excellent -- right on the water next to the Bay bridge. May 28 2008 	Everything you want from a city hotel	This place is somewhat of a hidden gem - or at least that's the impression I got.It's in all the guide books etc but just appears totally unfussy and just what you need in SF; relaxing, friendly, comfy.The location gets some stick but I think it's perfect. Firstly, getting there from the airport is so easy. You can of course take a cab but I would advise anyone travelling light or in a small group to take the BART from the Intl Airport to Embarcedaro station (then just 5mins walk down the hill). It's a fraction of the cost and takes just as long as a taxi. It's also at the far end of the Embarcadero from Fisherman's Wharf - meaning there is amazing walk along the bay (passed some great sites: Coit Tower and the Alcatraz departure quay) to the tourist hell (but a must!) that is FW. It's also smack across the street from the Ferry Building. This is a gem - worth getting up early (courtesy of jetlag) and wondering over to for coffee from Peets - while watching the commuters come of the ferries. That has to be one the single most enjoyable things to do. The Ferry Building also has some the best restaurants in the area (Taylors/Slanted Door) and of course the actual ferries to Tiburon etc. The hotel is at the bottom of the hill from SF proper (think Union Square, shops etc) but this is easy to solve via the cable car, street cars or a healthy walk up the hill (20mins?).So the actual hotel...is great. The rooms as large, super clean, soothing and quiet. There is some fuss made over the city and bay views. But to be honest how much time are you spending looking out of the window? We had a city view room - which actually meant staring at an empty office block. But if you want a view - they've got it. The bed was astonishingly comfy. The bathroom was stocked with Fresh toiletries which will forever evoke memories of SF. The only issue was with the bathroom door. A slider, with poor closure. So depending on who you are travelling with.....you may want to run the taps....The facilities aren't extensive, but just enough to sort on-line check in (business centre) and run a few miles (gym) - but shouldn't you be walking everywhere? The terraces are a huge asset, over looking the bay and Ferry Building. Although when we did sit out on them, security came up and asked if we were staying at the hotel - is that a good thing?The vibe the hotel tries to creates one of serenity and calm; all lavender aromas and earth tones. It totally works. And after a days of sightseeing, walking and burning the credit card...the minute you step into the lift playing soothing music and images....it's all miles away.The staff leave you alone - unless you need them. Which is the only way it should be.One note, the inhouse restaurant (Americano) gets crazy...it's a hot ticket in SF. So if you want a quiet meal, or drink on the patio - head over to the FB.

May 25 2008 	Fantastic hip special place!	We stayed at the Hotel Vitale for the weekend, staying in a Panoramic Suite. Try to request the highest floor available. We overlooked the Bay Bridge and the farmers market on Saturday morning at the Ferry Plaza. It was absolutely wonderful!The location was perfect for us, we could walk Market St and the Embarcadero. Boulevard, my favorite restaurant in the City is across the street. Yank Sing, the best Dim Sum in the City is around the corner. Again, the Ferry Plaza has incredible food too. The Slanted Door is infamous and Taylor's hamburgers are a must. Don't scoff, you must try one...Western Bacon Blue Ring is the best hangover cure around.There is a wine shop, cheese shop and a couple of deli style markets that are full time in the plaza. On the weekends, befitting to the epicurian loving locals that flood the market, these places are very busy. You don't need to get into the car during the day, everything is there within walking distance. At night, it is quiet, but it is easy to get a cab to go out to party if that is your scene. We arrived early Friday night and found the patio outside packed with the beautiful people. We assumed right away it was a private party. It ended up that it was just another Friday night at the stylin' bar downstairs. Cool... We didn't hang, but it would have been a great time forsure. We also didn't eat at the hotel restaurant, although the menu did look great. We did have fantastic, fast room service at three in the morning.We had massages together that were outstanding. Before that we did the outdoor bath that was nice. In hindsight though, we spent enough time in our amazing bathtub that we probably could have skipped it. The tub is on the rooftop and is completely private. It was very relaxing with killer strawberries, rose petals and a very relaxing atmosphere.The room was gorgeous. The bathtub is huge with amazing products. In the bathroom there is a dual shower, one with the rain showerhead and the other traditional. The toilet is in a separate private room. This is an incredible floor plan. We felt spoiled and didn't want to leave. I have absolutely nothing negative to say about Hotel Vitale and I am a tough critic. The staff was wonderful. I can't say enough positive words about this place, you must see it for yourself...

May 24 2008 	Great location	My brother lives in S.F and recommended this place. The hotel was what we expected when paying $350+ a night. We had a 2nd floor room that looked out onto Mission St. and the Bay Bridge. My only real complaint was the housekeeping on day one. We were out of the room from 7:30am to 4:30pm, but the room still hadn't been made up when we got back. We put the "Privacy" tag on the door to take a quick nap and in that time, missed housekeeping and turn down service all within an hour. We would go back - the location can't be beat. And the rooftop terrace is a nice addition.

May 9 2008 	Great Hotel; Lousy Valet	We stayed there on May 7 for just one night. Great location near the Embarcadero and Fisherman's Wharf. However, I have a huge problem when I called down for my car 30 minutes in advance of checking out (headed to the airport), and 50 minutes later, the valet shows up with THE WRONG CAR!!! May 5 2008 	Excellent Choice Right on the Embarcadero	I stayed at the Hotel Vitale for two nights in late April on a business trip.The hotel is warm and welcoming, with comfortable wood finishes throughout. My room had a very comfortable bed, a usable desk, ample storage space and was very quiet, despite being located in a very busy area, Mission between the Embarcadero and Steuart.The hotel's locaiton is ideal for anyone in SF on business downtown. When you walk out the front door, you're greeted by a picture-postcard view of the Bay Bridge and if you walk a few steps, the renovated Ferry Building and it's handy gourmet food stalls. May 4 2008 	We were very pleased with this lovely hotel	We spent a week at Hotel Vitale. The service was friendly and helpful. The rooms and decor were upscale, contemporary, sleek and lovely. We were there as a family of three, and room was a little dangerous for a toddler based on the sophisticated furnishings. May 1 2008	almost great	Lots of nice features. Great free available business center. 2 free morning newspapers. Excellent concierge (Brian). Comfortable room. Good location. Apr 10 2008 	Had a Wonderful Stay	I stayed at the Hotel Vitale for 5 days in late February and recommend it highly. The design of the hotel is perfect for a relaxing getaway in one of the best cities in the world. From the front door to the roof decks, everything is spa-like. (There is also an actual spa at the hotel, but I did not try it.) Our room (a king size, bay view) featured soothing colors, natural materials, and even smelled good (not that usual stale hotel smell). The bed had a pristine, white duvet cover. Bedside table has a CD player (with new age-y CD collection) but you can plug your iPod into it. We had a loveseat and arm chair over in the window nook. The bathroom was large, with a glassed-in shower with rainforest shower head. Best of all, the toiletries were made by Fresh and were lovely. The hotel also has 2 roof decks for guest use and a fun restaurant in the lobby - it has an indoor lounge and outdoor terrace that seem to be extremely popular with young businesspeople. The restaurant isn't cheap, but it's worth checking out. We found every staff person we interacted with to be friendly and helpful. In addition to turndown service, a manager came by in the evening to make sure everything was to our liking - a pleasant touch. The location was great for us - right across the street from the Ferry Terminal, where we found a few good restaurants, lots of great snacks (including Cowgirl Creamery for cheese, a great bread store and a wine shop), and an incredible outdoor Farmer's Market twice a week (Tuesday and Saturday). If you're not a walker, the hotel is about 2 blocks from one end of the cablecar line as well as the Embarcadero BART station, and the streetcars go past the hotel as well. We found it a convenient walk to Union Square, the SF Moma, etc., but we really like walking. The only thing we didn't like about the hotel was the supposedly high-speed internet. The free internet service moved at a crawl, whether you were wireless or plugged in. There was also a paid option. But for the amount the room cost, and how little internet costs, they really should provide genuinely high speed connections for free (as they advertise). You may not have any need for internet, but if you are traveling on business be aware that connecting to the office won't be easy. However, in all, it's a really fabulous place and I completely recommend it.

Apr 1 2008	A different side of San Fran....	I was hesitant about booking this hotel as it was not in a central location, however after having stayed in many San Fran hotels even the 5 star seemed to be a bit lackluster/old and this place seemed fresh/new.I loved the room it was fabulous, modern, clean, relaxing. I could not have asked for more. The hallways are also very quiet, dimly lit, pleasing to the eye. The staff are really pleasant from the concierge to the maids, check-inThe hotel is a few blocks down from Union Sq which you may think a disadvantage but for us we discovered a whole new side of San Fran. 'Slanted Door' fab vietnemese/fusion food, 'Boulevard' across the street ranked as one of San Frans' best restaurants.We went to Union Sq one day and I was so glad to get back to the hotel, the water....so relaxing.I did think by the website that this hotel was a spa resort directly on the water it's not, there isn't a spa just one treatment room. I will advise you that there isn't much of a downstairs lobby area to hang out in either and the only disappointment I had was the bar/restaurant area. I went their one evening after dinner and it was full of drunken kids, I guess they also open their doors to the main street so anyone can walk in. Otherwise super city hotel.

Mar 30 2008 	Our new favorite place to stay in San Francisco	We absolutely loved our stay at Hotel Vitale. Mar 21 2008 	Prime location	Great hotel. Contemporary, friendly, very stylish. Excellent location with everything close by and some amazing views of the bridge. Only downside was that the bar closes early. Everything else great.

Jan 28 2008	***** Star Service	SO much has been said about this property already, but I am happy to report The Hotel Vitale is my new found fave in San Francisco. Jan 21 2008 	Best service I've ever gotten	After seeing their lovely website, I had high expectations for the Hotel Vitale, and my expectations were surpassed. The room (an Urban Suite) was large and flanked with a full curving wall of windows that afforded city views. The decor is lovely and calming (if a little trendy), and all the materials used are high-quality. The bedding was beautiful and comfortable; towels and robes big and soft; iPod stereo a nice touch. (I would have liked a DVD player for the TV, but that's a minor thing.) The deep soaking tub, placed to have views of the night sky, was heavenly. Room service, ordered at 11pm, was fast and tasty.But where the Hotel Vitale really impressed me was with the service of the staff. They were unobtrusive but friendly and accommodating. Jan 18 2008 	Very solid choice	Hotel Vitale is a beautiful hotel if you like modern architecture and fittings. We chose it for New Year's Eve specifically because it has a rooftop location overlooking the fireworks on the Embarcadero. We also chose it because we were travelling with 4 kids, and we needed 2 queen beds per room. Vitale fit the bill, plus it had good reviews.The bad:1. Our check in did not go smoothly. We had asked for rooms near each other, if not connecting. When we arrived, the girl at the front desk was completely clueless, first telling us that nothing like that was available, snapping at me when I asked if we could upgrade to make it available, and finally giving us precisely what we had asked for and arranged for in advance. It was very odd. 2. To make matters worse, once our kids went to their room, they discovered that someone else was already in that room. Nice shock for our children. I tried calling from our room to tell them the problem, but no one answered the phone - twice. I then went down to the front desk to tell them, and there was no apology - again strange. Just a response that "there must have been a computer glich." Duh. The kids ended up being on an entirely different floor from us - and no compensation for the aggravation, etc.3. The rooms are SMALL!!!! The smallest on our California trip (we stayed in 5 different places). Location was perfect for us, but may not work for most tourist's needs. It's right across from the Embarcadero and the market, which is fun. Jan 6 2008 	Good Hotel	I stayed at the Hotel Vitale the first Thursday night of 2008 as part of a quick business trip. I arrived at Oakland International and rode Bart to get to the hotel. I was checked into the room less than one hour after stepping off the plane. Bart cost $6.55 including the $3.00 for the bus transfer from airport to Colosseum Bart Station. The hotel was about three blocks from the Embarcadero Bart Station and is in a modern building.Walking in, the doorman opened the sturdy wooden front door for me and I found my self at the front desk. Check in took about 5 minutes. Halls were moderately dim but tastefully decorated. Rooms are well marked. I was in a King room on the 2nd floor (242) facing Steuart St. The room has commercial grade carpet, a long desk, one office chair, one lounge chair and the king bed. There is an in-room bar and snack tray with unmarked prices that I did not sample. The television is a flat panel above the desk and is about 24 inches with a standard remote and cable. There is a closet that had two bathrobes (soft linen, comfy). A small alcove hid the iron and ironing board.The internet access was both wired and wireless. Either choice was free, just agree to pay $0.00 online, and you were in with pretty speedy web access. I chose wired access as the wireless was unencrypted. There was a much appreciated row of power plugs at the desk level for computer, cell phone etc. The night stand had a stereo-clock radio-MP3-CD player with a docking station probably for an Ipod and a remote control. There was a selection of 5 CD's of music. It mysteriously came on twice by itself during my evening there and required a few minutes of twiddling to turn off. It was on when I came back from dinner, but that time probably from the turn-down service.The bed was comfortable with 4 enormous down pillows. The linens were fine, but the bed was curiously short sheeted--nothing that couldn't be remedied by undoing the meticulous job the maid did before my arrival. Towels were many in the bathroom that had a combination tub shower with shower curtain, sink with reasonably sized counter and toilet. The floor and walls were tiled. There was a can of 90% oxygen in the bathroom. The price for breaking the seal was $69.95!Walls and windows did not keep out the traffic noises either on the street or in the hallway, but I did not hear any neighbors. Twice after 10 PM, I heard trucks doing trash dumpster collecting. Both occasions were loud and lasted about 5-10 minutes.There was a small business center down the hall with three computer stations and a printer, no charge. The fitness center contained three or four machines with individual small TV's.Breakfast in the restaurant was quite good. The prices ranged from about $9 to $19. There was no free option.Check out was painless. My breakfast charge did not make it to the final bill by my checkout, but the clerk promised to email the final bill to me. I have not yet received it after 36 hours, but I am sure that they won't forget to bill me. I would stay here again.

Nov 12 2007 	Not A Good Value!	We spent a night last weekend at the Hotel Vitale. The location is great -- across the street from the Embarcadero & the Ferry Building/farmer's market. "What is your name?" he demanded. When we told him, he said he had no record of us signing the check-in card. Nov 6 2007	Set the standards high for the rest of the hotels we stayed at	We started a 14-day vacation with 5 days in San Francisco at this fantastic hotel. Oct 7 2007 	top service gorgeous modern hip and stylish yet relaxing hotel	This is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in.My husband and I stayed at the Vitale for four nights for the first part of our honeymoon last month.The service is amazing, they treat you like royalty! the hotel is clean, hip, decor is gorg, it's relaxing, yet has a busy bar, amazing open top baths on the hotel roof and fantastic views of the bay bridge.We checked in after a long flight from London and the staff at reception were very kind and welcoming. Aug 14 2007 	Room with a View	I've never stayed in the same San Francisco hotel twice (I've stayed in over a dozen different hotels at this point), but I do plan to return to the Vitale. While other hotels in San Francisco boast more luxuries, the Vitale has a good price to amenities ratio. It's modern with free WiFi that actually works; the location is excellent, and the views are stunning. I had a large enough corner room with a delightful view of the Ferry Building and the Bay Bridge. A few things worth mentioning if you are considering staying here: many rooms, even the more expensive ones (I had a waterfront room at over $400/night) do NOT have bathtubs. The room service breakfast leaves a lot to be desired, and the Fresh bathroom products (sugar lemon) left me feeling like I'd been working too long at a children's lemonade stand. The staff are very nice, although they don't always get things that count right (check in and out has it's glitches). Also unless you are interested in a pick up scene, the downstairs bar is not for you. That being said, the mini bar is excellent and with the sofa and view from my room, as well as the private terraces for guests, there are plenty of places for that quite beverage with a view.

Aug 13 2007	discrimination	The mistreatment of the prolific professor Ngugi Wa Thiong'o at Hotel Vitale in San Francisco, California. This incident occurred on November 10, 2006. The hotel worker in question still works at Vitale, where he continues his racist behaviors towards Black guests under the support of Hotel managers.By Ngugi Wa Thiong'o I checked into Hotel Vitale on Thursday, 9th November in room 640. The following morning, Friday 10th, I went for a brunch and a walk at the water front and then came back into the hotel, at around 1pm, lunch time, took a newspaper, San Francisco Chronicle, at Concierge's desk and went into a nice porch in the Americano, the hotel's restraunt, where I sat and read while also enjoying a nice view of the ferry and waterfrontfrom the window. I was all alone in the porch. A white man, about 5' 4", dressed in a gray suit stood in front of me."This place is for guests of the hotel. You have to leave, " he said.At first I was intrigued by his words: how did he arrive at the conclusion that I was Not aguest of the hotel? So I asked him: "How do you know that I am not a guest of the hotel?""You have to leave. This is for guests of the hotel.""But how do you know that I am not a guest?" I asked him again."You have to leave.""But you have not even asked me if I am staying in the hotel"'Okay. Are you staying at the hotel?'The tone and demeanor was of a man who had made up his mind that I could not have beena guest."Let's us go to the reception desk," I told him."It is not necessary," he said. "Just leave.""Who are you? What is your name?" I now asked remembering that the man had not even identified himself."It is not necessary," He replied curtly. "Just leave.""This is sheer harassment. You find me reading a newspaper peacefully. You don't identifyyourself. You don't ask if I am a guest. And you refuse to identify yourself. And now you afraid of going to the Reception desk?Why?After a few more exchanges, repeating the things, he says: "Okay, let's go."By this time, I am fuming with rage, The man strides towards the reception desk. I also getthere and ask the staff to check whether or not I was the occupant of room 640. Even before any of the aghast staff had said anything, the man had started apologizing. But I kept on asking him: How could he do what he did? Find me reading a newspaper that the Concierge had given me, and proceed with such emotional violence on my person?The lobby manager, a David (?) recognized me as the Random House guest, and started apologizing for the behaviour of the man, whom I assumed by now to be the Restaurant Manager, and who by then had had left the scene. No explanation about his conduct. The Lobby manager went to get the Hotel Manager who came down and apologized for what he termed as some misunderstanding."But it was not a misunderstanding," I said. "I was quietly reading a newspaper when he accosted me.""Okay, for his behaviour. David will get you a room,""But I have got a room. Room 640. I checked in last night.""Oh! I am sorry! Is there anything we can do to make up?""You need to talk to your man, not me.""Yes, I shall, but are you sure there is nothing we can do to make up? A massage? A whiskey?"It was clear to me that even the Hotel Manager did not understand the depth of the emotional violence on me by a member of his staff.I went back to my room called Katherine Freeman and asked to change the hotel. I moved to St Francis Westin.Words alone cannot describe the horror of the occasion, the emotional violation I experienced but time will heal it.

Aug 6 2007 	Hip Comfort in the heart of the Embarcadero	We met up in San Francisco with some other out-of-town family members at the Hotel Vitale who were also in town for business. I did some research and wound up choosing this hotel as a great location that would be pleasing to all the varying tastes of all those involved... a motley crew of varied ages, ethnicities, genders, budgets and interests. Surprisingly EVERYONE WAS SATISFIED!!The location was absolutely perfect for getting around the Embarcadero on foot. Several wonderful restaurants were just steps away (particularly the pricey, but OH, so worth it! One Market). If its raining or you just dont feel like straying too far from the comfort of the hotel, the on-site restaurant Americano is an excellent choice for great food, too. In fact rolling out of bed and grabbing a decent breakfast in the area is quite difficult so I would strongly recommend doing so at Americano. Just make sure you get there before they stop serving it (at 10:30AM). Americano is also a great location for lunch & dinner. Anyone looking to have an intimate conversation or trying to bring together a group of people should know that this place gets LOUD, crowded, and sceney as the night gets going. Apparently reservations are strongly recommended too, as this is a quite the HIP LOCALE for locals as well. So dont be surprised to come down from your room on any given night and find a virtual night-club scene going on. And those who are waiting to get in tend to linger in the lobby. This was not a nuisance to me as a guest, but it could be to some. Also the noise didnt affect my stay there at all either, so no worries there.The room was beautiful stunning really. Even the concave window added to the uniqueness of the room. The bed was incredibly comfortable, and the staff turned on soothing ambient music with the Turn-Down service each night, leaving a little quote or poem on our pillow.And now the reason I chose our Urban Studio room THE DEEP SOAKING TUB! Wow! So worth the experience! I absolutely looked forward to my evening soaks, and made sure to let them last as long as possible. After all with a tub that deep, the water seems to stay warm forever, and why get out at all unless necessary? I should caution against the Privacy Factor, as there really is none. The tub is practically in the room. Its actually sort of just around the corner and not in a separate bathroom. So I do hope you are really close with your fellow traveler (i.e. LOVER/SPOUSE/SIGNIFICANT OTHER  CLOSE).Did I love it? Yes! And I even got kudos from each of my other family members for the choice. Would I or any of them stay there again? You betcha!! Great dcor, superb comfort & pampering, amazing food, and very personable and friendly costumer service, all for a surprisingly budget-friendly price and in one of the most beautiful cities in the U.S who could ask for anything more??!!

The bathtub was big and comfortable (one of my pet issues in hotels) and the amenities provides were more than we expected. Our room was quiet and comfortable. CD's in the room with different kinds of music were a nice touch.

Jun 12 2007 	Believe the reviews!	Hotel Vitale really is a cut above. The rooms are beautifully furnished, and ours had a spectacular view of the Bay Bridge and Ferry Building. The staff is friendly and accommodating. Often you might expect the staff at high-end "chic" hotels to be snooty or elitist- the staff here could not have been more helpful and pleasant. The bathrooms are a real treat- waterfall showers, glass walled shower, clean and attractive. However, there is little privacy to be had- the bathroom has an industrial-style sliding door (not a pocket door) with 2" gaps on either side between the wall and door. Anyone passing by the bathroom will be able to see you in the shower!Skip the Americano restaurant unless you're visiting for drinks during the very popular after-work social hours. The menu is very pricey, and while the food is good the restaurant does not live up to its cost. The upholstery was in surprisingly bad shape and the wait staff was so-so. I would highly recommend this hotel to any San Francisco visitors. Be aware that it is a 20-30 minute walk to the touristy Union Square and Pier 39/Fisherman's Wharf areas. The location, however, is adjacent to the financial district and the recently renovated Ferry Building with its many celebrated restaurants.

Jun 9 2007 	Left My Heart In San Francisco	San Francisco has never really been on my radar as a must visit place. How wrong I was. Without doubt this is now my favourite city on the planet.The warmth and diversity of the people. All filled with civic pride and useful what to see tips. The charm and individuality of the neighbourhoods. The vibrancy of the bars and restaurants  I could go on but this review is really about the hotel.Hotel Vitale is top class. Located in the Mission district right on the Embarcadero it is the perfect start point for exploring the key SF attractions. I booked 2 advance seats on a shared van ride (supershuttle) to get to/from the airport. Reasonable rate at $70 for 2 roundtrip (including tip). This is a first come first served basis but we only had to wait 5 mins. At the airport you have to look for a representative in a green jacket. It is not possible to just deal with the driver. From memory it took about 20 mins in bust traffic.On arrival at the Vitale the bell staff are super friendly and will unload your cases and wait patiently while you check in.Hot towels are offered in the super chic reception area. Front desk staff were very welcoming and offered a free upgrade right from the start. Answered all questions efficiently and provided a city map for orientation.Really nice bell guy showed us to our room and explained that he had only move to SF a year ago and was still experiencing the city like a tourist. He engaged us in a easy conversation about our interests and made various recommendations including a trip to Sausaltio from the ferry building almost directly opposite (do this it is a beautiful place). Would also recommend the evening Alcatraaz trip (book well in advance).This guys helpfulness was only surpassed by the concierge who came up with the perfect options for whatever we requested.Room was immaculate and bathroom was a dream. Walk in rainfall shower and brimming with expensive toiletries. Excellent furnishings and super comfy bed/pillows. CD player with a selection of compilations. Ambient noise maker (whales, running water etc  nice touch). LCD TV and a well stocked mini bar including a Lovers kit ?. 2nd floor Room with bay view directly over the bar. Agree with all the other comments about the huge happy hour crowds and noise. We didnt manage to get an evening drink in the bar but the noise wasnt an issue for us as we were generally out late. If you dont like noise and like an early night  book a higher floor if you are on the bay side. The room seemed a bit small after coming from our five room suite in The Hotel at The Mandalay Bay (but what wouldnt)We had mentioned it was our anniversary. 10 minutes after arrival there was a knock on the door with a bottle of complimentary champagne and a card from the front desk staff. The first glass hadnt been emptied before there was another knock which was the housekeeping manager who presented us with a picture frame and another hand written anniversary card. It didnt stop there  The second night saw a fresh bunch of Daffs with another card. The last night it was rose petals on the bed. Housekeeping was perfect. Free office / internet service on the second floor. Free yoga class in the gym. Amazing room service.Having stayed in top hotels all over the world I can say that I have never experienced this level of service.You must visit this hotel.

May 29 2007	Book the Hotel Vitale it is worth it	My husband and I just spent two lovely days at the Hotel Vitale for a get away to San Francisco. May 25 2007 	Awesome place	I love this hotel! May 15 2007 	My favorite hotel in SF	This way my first visit to this hotel, and certainly won't be my last. May 13 2007 	Simply Awesome!!!!!	All I can say is WOW WOW WOW!!!!!!! I booked a circular suite (7th floor - the highest one available) because of a) a king bed, b) the view and c) the soaking tub. May 10 2007	Mostly Great	I've stayed at this hotel 3 times so far this year for business. Overall I'm extremely pleased with this hotel. The valet and front desk folks are very pleasant and helpful. But there are plenty of food options in the neighborhood, and the food via room service (once it gets to you) is great, so not a big deal.I've never stayed anywhere else in SF so can't really compare it to anything. But overall am very pleased with it.

May 9 2007	Great Location and Views but......	My husband and I checked into the Hotel Vitale for a getaway weekend to San Francisco. As I began to look a little closer, however, I noticed a fairly heavily stained carpet, and a rather austere look to the room. Apr 19 2007 	Excellent Hotel	In our 16 days trip in US we have stayed in 7 different hotels and Vital was by far the best one.Because: a) the general atmosphere and energy of the hotel was superb. b) the service was excellent; personnel has been very attentive and at the same time simple, gentle and efficient c) decoration was very nice both in the room and the public areas of the hotel d) location very convenientWe stayed (three nights) in a room facing the back of the building and a roof with ventilators etc. We wanted a very quiet room and after checking two other rooms ended in this room without view but cozy and indeed very quiet and (we preferred that over a room facing Mission Street with window from floor to ceiling which we felt less cosy and more exposed).Room was spacious and very clean, the bed very good (but not excellent), nice bathroom, all the standard amenities plus free wireless internet and flat TV. Mar 24 2007	Best Hotel in the USA	The Hotel Vitale in San Francisco was amazing. We hesitated over the price ,100 dollars more than we had in mind, but it was well worth the extra. Mar 19 2007 	Lovely but possibly overrated?	This is a beautiful boutique hotel. That being said, I was a little down about my stay there. We booked a waterfront deluxe room, which was very , very nice. The problem we encountered was the noise from Americano Bar right below us. As other reviewers have mentioned, there is quite the bar scene outside. And if you are young, single and beautiful, it's a great place to be. If you are older, tired and sleep lightly, a third floor room above the bar is a very bad idea. You can practically hear individual conversations, with the window closed and the drapes pulled. However, the front desk staff were very gracious and moved us to another room, on a higher floor. Kudo's to them. Unfortunately, we left behind a more deluxe bathroom, the waters given to us at turndown, one less chair and no paper in the morning. I guess they forgot they moved us. I can't help but wonder how often people request a move from the third or fourth floors. To be fair, it was a Thursday night and the weather had been absolutely beautiful. However, hotel staff told us that this happens every Thursday/Friday/Saturday night. If you are going to stay here and you want a deluxe water view room, ask for a room above the 5th floor.My only other quibble; almost $50.00 charged for Valet Parking...WOW! I've stayed in fine hotels all over the world and never paid almost $50.00 for less than 24 hours of parking. I guess my expectations were much higher than this hotel could meet. I would not stay here again. If you are a design devotee, love a hip atmosphere and are under 40, and have the money, this is the place for you. Otherwise, be warned.
